It's time to revitalize Vermont's education system. By exploring all options, we can save millions while providing kids a high-quality education. #vtpoli #thinkvt https://t.co/84qgeGKxdc
Join me in working to eliminate the tax on social security for low and moderate-income Vermonters #vtpoli #thinkvt https://t.co/fOwASQUNTd
Congratulations to all the Vermonters who will be representing us at the Winter Olympics. We‚Äôre very proud of all the hard work you‚Äôve put in to qualify for @TeamUSA https://t.co/kT3MubwZdW

We can have the courage to put Vermont on a clear, disciplined path‚Ä¶ we can work to restore our economic foundation‚Ä¶ we can expand our workforce, create jobs, and make Vermont more affordable for our families and businesses. #vtpoli

If we have the courage to discuss all options, with civility and respect‚Ä¶we can save millions of dollars, invest in creating the best Cradle-to-Career system in the nation, give our kids the brightest possible future, and attract more families to all areas of Vermont. #vtpoli

(3/3) Finally, we should chart a course that moves us from having 1 adult for every 4 students to having 1 adult for every 5 students over the next 5 years using the natural retirement attrition of the current workforce. This alone would save us well over $100 million each year.
(2/3) 3rd, we need to provide districts the flexibility, tools and incentives they need to make sure consolidations save money, and improve outcomes for children.

(1/3) 1st, we must contain costs to eliminate the current deficit & achieve savings that will expand over time & prevent costs from growing faster than wages. 2nd, we must establish a statewide funding system that is fully transparent, easily understood, & truly equitable.

Year after year, Vermonters have endured property tax rate increases they cannot afford. It‚Äôs time to accept reality. Due to the steady decrease in student population‚Ä¶the current funding mechanism‚Ä¶is weakening the very system it was meant to strengthen. #vtpoli
Children impacted by the opioid epidemic‚Ä¶are the true victims of our struggle with addiction. So long as I‚Äôm Governor, we will not turn our backs or a blind eye to them. #vtpoli

(2/2) We‚Äôll soon be looking to harness the imagination and competitive nature of entrepreneurs, scientists and inventors‚Ä¶ incentivizing the most efficient and commercially viable ways to segregate, process, package and sell phosphorous. #vtpoli

(1/2) The key to cleaning up our lakes & waterways is reducing the amount of phosphorous flowing into them. We‚Äôre exploring how the State can help create a commercial enterprise that captures a large amount of VT‚Äôs excess phosphorous, & convert it to a wholesale or retail product
Environmental innovation can also be economic innovation‚Ä¶ and we can‚Äôt do one without the other. #vtpoli #thinkvt

To help make electric vehicles more affordable‚Ä¶I propose we invest $1.8 million from our Volkswagen settlement to electrify our system, making Vermont more accessible to electric vehicles, for both residents and visitors. #vtpoli

To achieve VT‚Äôs goal of 90 percent renewable energy by 2050‚Ä¶we‚Äôll invest $300,000 to help homeowners replace old, non-EPA-certified wood stoves w/ modern efficient ones. This improves air quality‚Ä¶saves folks money‚Ä¶And supports local shops & our forest products economy. #vtpoli

With a $600,000 investment, and a partnership with Norwich University‚Ä¶ we can establish a Security Operations Center that provides round-the-clock monitoring and protection against cyber-attacks. #vtpoli

I‚Äôll propose enhancements to VEGI to make it more accessible to small businesses & B-Corps--companies committed to social & environmental goals, as well as a profitable bottom line...making VT the destination for mission-driven businesses & attracting mission-driven millennials.

VT ranks as one of the top states for the number of start-ups. But we rank last among the 25 smallest states in helping those businesses scale up, succeed & grow. I propose investing $400,000‚Ä¶to help small businesses & entrepreneurs finance scalable opportunities faster. #vtpoli

Becoming a conduit between our schools and our employers‚Ä¶will help small businesses and keep more of our college students here in VT. This budget directs $100,000 to help the Department of Labor work with colleges, universities, and industry partners to make this happen. #vtpoli

As you know, we face population trends that, left unaddressed, will continue to result in fewer workers, fewer taxpayers and fewer students in our schools. That‚Äôs why, I‚Äôve proposed a $3.2 million-dollar investment in a campaign to reverse these trends. #vtpoli

I‚Äôve directed the Department of Labor to provide employment services to those in recovery through regular hours at Vermont‚Äôs Recovery Centers‚Ä¶Employment counselors will serve 3 recovery centers by the end of this Spring & all of them by the end of the year, at no additional cost

As we make strides in the battle against opiates, we‚Äôll do more to help VTers in recovery find and hold a job‚Äîwhere, through an honest day‚Äôs work, they can earn back the trust, and self-esteem, that addiction took from them. #vtpoli
I‚Äôm proposing $625,000 in incentives to help renovate and upgrade existing housing stock, helping to attract young, working families to communities across the state. #vtpoli #thinkvt

To help working families achieve the dream of home ownership, this budget doubles funding of the Down Payment Assistance Program. And, for the second consecutive year, it increases our investment in downtown and village center tax credits. #vtpoli

Last year, we came together, to bring more new housing to the market, which was a good start. This year‚Äôs budget funds a one-million-dollar housing package, to build on that progress. #vtpoli #thinkvt

Only 5 states fully tax social security retirement benefits. Today, I ask you to join me in bringing that number to 4, by beginning to eliminate this tax on seniors living on low and moderate incomes. #vtpoli #thinkvt

If we do nothing‚Ä¶unfunded liabilities will be more than we raise in annual revenue‚Ä¶We must prevent future obligations from forcing deep cuts in vital programs‚Ä¶that‚Äôs why my budget devotes $20 million more than required to paydown these liabilities. #vtpoli
This budget prioritizes investments that will get more Vermonters into the workforce, recruit families to our state, create jobs, expand small businesses, and grow wages. #vtpoli

Today, I present to Vermonters a balanced budget that makes strategic investments to grow the economy, make Vermont more affordable, and protect the most vulnerable. And for the 2nd consecutive year, it does NOT raise taxes or fees. #vtpoli

full_text: ‚ÄúIf we do these things, we will make a difference in the lives of Vermonters, we will live up to the promise of our history, and in the decades to come the record will show, in our nation's hour of need. Vermonters, once again, led the way.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúWe have an opportunity to set an example with our actions. We can commit to meaningful dialogue and be guided by our shared principles. We can work together towards consensus whenever possible, and compromise when its required.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúNow, I don‚Äôt know when this period of hyper-partisanship and anger will end. But I do know we can't fight hate with hate, or anger with anger. We must do everything we can, to pull our nation out of darkness and restore civility and respect to our public process.‚Äù #VTSOTS
‚ÄúProgress requires a willingness to compromise, to listen, to find consensus and to be honest and respectful brokers on behalf of all Vermonters.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúIf we demonstrate the fiscal discipline to hold the line on taxes & fees‚Ä¶ we will put our state on solid footing so we can invest in programs we value & leave Vermont better prepared for the next time the national or global economy takes a turn for the worse‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúI also created an Opioid Coordination Council to strengthen our approach, and they‚Äôve spent the last year working just that, identifying strategies to address the four legs of the stool: prevention, treatment, recovery and enforcement.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúWe must also continue to combat the opioid crisis. Last year we funded a new treatment Hub in St. Albans. This helped us eliminate the waitlist in Chittenden County, which once included more than 700.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúLast year, we committed $51 million to clean water projects, increasing state funding by 70 percent. Our Agencies of Natural Resources, Agriculture and Transportation have already put more than $17 million to work for cleaner water.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúWe listened to our frontline State Employees, & their ideas are working to make government more efficient & effective. Through our PIVOT program, state employees are working closely with our Chief Performance Officer to identify & eliminate inefficiencies.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúI look forward to working w/ you on econ development proposals, aimed at expanding growth to all 14 counties so all families, all kids feel the hope of a bright future in VT‚Ä¶Montpelier must do more to help every person, every community & every county, succeed & thrive.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúFrom the NEK to the Marble Valley‚Ä¶from Richford to Readsboro, Rochester to Rygate, the small towns & regional economic centers that helped build our state are stuck in an economic cycle they did not create‚Ä¶The time has come to make this session, their session.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúWe also expanded the number of Tax Increment Financing ‚Äì or TIF ‚Äì districts by six. With this economic tool, communities like Bennington, Springfield and Newport can now drive much-needed development in parts of the state that need it most.‚Äù #VTSOTS

(2/2) This will result in over 600 additional units, with more than 100 under construction this year. It will employ 1,000 Vermonters, attract new workers to the state, and generate $10 million in new wages.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚Äú(1/2) Last year, we made the single largest investment in housing in our history with a $35 million housing bond, which leveraged another $65 million in private investment, to increase the availability of decent, affordable homes for our workforce.‚Äù #VTSOTS
‚ÄúIn my budget address I‚Äôll also propose a bold, sophisticated campaign to identify and persuade working age individuals, families and entrepreneurs to relocate to Vermont.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúIf we want to compete with other states, we must make Vermont more affordable for retired Veterans, which is why I‚Äôll propose to remove the income tax on military pensions.‚Äù #VTSOTS #SupportOurTroops
‚ÄúI‚Äôm proposing a package to level the playing field by offering tuition-free college in Vermont, for those who commit to serve in our National Guard.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúMy Administration is developing a workforce expansion plan that looks at how we educate and place our students, train and retrain to create more opportunities, and how we recruit more families and graduating students to live and work here.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúIf we work together to transform our K-12 system, based on the needs of our kids and not nostalgia, we can invest much more in early care and learning, technical education, workforce readiness training, & higher education without raising the price tag on Vermonters.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúI, along with my Administration and members of the legislature, stand ready to prevent taxes and fees from increasing again this year. And, just so I‚Äôm clear, that includes statewide property tax rates.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúWe passed a budget that invested in our people and economy, without raising a single tax or fee. We closed a budget gap of more than $60 million, and limited budget growth to just over 1% while wages grew at about 2%.‚Äù #VTSOTS

‚ÄúEarly in my career working construction, I learned that when you find yourself in a hole and have a problem, the first thing you do is stop digging. Well, I‚Äôm proud to report that last year we stopped digging.‚Äù #VTSOTS
‚ÄúThe challenges we face are great, but none greater than proceeding with the work ahead of us in a manner that Vermonters can be proud of.‚Äù #VTSOTS

My hope is that at the end of the summit we‚Äôll leave united around this mission... The outcome I know we‚Äôre all working towards, which is better opportunities for our kids. #VTEdSummit

‚ÄúI want to assure you, my administration is committed to working with you. We know one size doesn‚Äôt fit all, and we want to hear about the unique challenges that exist throughout the state." #VTEdSummit

‚ÄúEvery dollar we spend on underutilized space in our schools is a dollar that‚Äôs not being spent on a child. This is a long-term threat to Vermont‚Äôs economy & to the education our children deserve. We hope much of the discussion will focus on this today.‚Äù #VTEdSummit
‚ÄúAnd we all watch as the education community struggles to preserve academic services as class sizes get smaller and overhead costs increase faster than our economy grows.‚Äù #VTEdSummit

‚ÄúFor nearly two decades we have heard the calls from Vermonters for property tax relief. Yet instead every year, taxes were raised, which raised more revenue and is now over $1.6 Billion to educate 30,000 fewer students than we had 25 years ago.‚Äù #VTEdSummit

‚ÄúWe will propose a plan to address the shortfall in the Ed Fund but it‚Äôs important to realize that while this year‚Äôs projected increase in rates is larger than in the past, the trend of per pupil spending outpacing growth in the economy & wages is not new‚Äù #VTEdSummit
‚ÄúVermonters can't afford [a property tax increase], which adds to the sense of urgency. I also know, and I hope you agree, that together we can find solutions.‚Äù #VTEdSummit
‚ÄúWe must increase the value students see from the dollars we spend, while providing relief from costs that continue to grow faster than Vermonters can afford to pay.‚Äù #VTEdSummit

‚ÄúGiven these challenges, we have an urgent need to transform our education system into the best in the country, with what we spend today, and what we can afford to invest in the future.‚Äù #VTEdSummit
‚ÄúWe see over 1000 fewer students every single year, to the point where we‚Äôre now educating 30,000 fewer students than we were 25 years ago.‚Äù #VTEdSummit

‚ÄúVermont finds itself in the unenviable position of being the second oldest, as well as one of the fastest aging states in the country. This impacts our economy, schools and ability to provide public services in major ways.‚Äù #VTEdSummit
‚ÄúToday‚Äôs turnout reflects our shared commitment to providing children with the best possible educational opportunities we can.‚Äù #VTEdSummit

Thx to all ‚Äúfor their work & commitment to growing the economy, making VT more affordable, & protecting the most vulnerable.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúWe have a budget that is centered on making VT more affordable‚Ä¶& passed legislation w/ out raising revenue on the backs of VTers.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúThis budget represents progress & a shift in thinking..When I find myself in a hole, I stop digging. This year we stopped digging.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúResidential property tax rates will be lower than in Fiscal Year 2017.‚Äù #vtpoli #vtbudget
‚ÄúThis budget, for the first time in recent memory, does not raise taxes and fees, & that includes property tax rates.‚Äù #vtpoli #vtbudget
‚ÄúWe reached an agreement w/ the Legislature on an education savings proposal which will save VT taxpayers millions.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúI created the Government Modernization and Efficiency Team charged w/ finding ways to streamline services to reduce costs.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúWe took an moved toward modernizing state gov w/ the creation of the Agency of Digital Services which merges IT functions.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúBudget supports the state‚Äôs mental health services, allotting $8M+ to increase salaries for workers & invest in crisis services.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúWe increased funding to @VSC_edu by $3M & @VTEducation has a new position for Career Pathways Coordinator.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúThis budget increases funding for the Child Care Financial Assistance Program to help more Vermonters receive a childcare subsidy.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúThese initiatives will help support our businesses, workforce, job growth, and drive economic development.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúWe also allocated $250K for economic development marketing.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúWe invested an additional $100K to support regional microbusiness development programs.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúWe invested $150K to expand the number of small business development centers.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúWe increased the # of Tax Increment Financing districts‚Ä¶& made changes to support housing developments + downtown growth.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúOne obstacle to attracting families...is affordable housing. To begin addressing that, we passed a $35M housing bond.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúThis budget achieves these goals in a way that ensures state spending isn‚Äôt growing faster than our economy.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúThese goals were at the heart of the budget I presented in January, which was balanced without raising taxes and fees.‚Äù #vtpoli
‚ÄúI issued an executive order outlining strategic goals...Grow the economy, make VT more affordable & protect the most vulnerable.‚Äù #vtpoli
